intro: Splitgerbera japonica, commonly known as the Japanese gerbera, is a striking ornamental plant native to Japan and Korea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, showy daisy-like flowers with vibrant colors such as red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it suitable for gardens and container planting. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in various parts of the world for decorative purposes.
